isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - LIFT CAB MECHANICALLY (WITH HOIST - Figure 12 )

svcproc.title: LIFT CAB MECHANICALLY (WITH HOIST - Figure 12)

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. LIFTING SUPPORT HOOKS WITH CAB WOOD BLOCK PROTECTORS

caution.para: If the hydraulic system must be opened for replacement or repairs, make sure an overhead hoist is available. Keep dirt or other contaminants from entering the hydraulic system. Do not attempt to mechanically pull the cylinders to retract or extend as pressure at the cylinder port is required to release cylinder check valves. Cylinder damage may result from the mechanical pull.

svcproc.para: To lift the cab to make the necessary hydraulic repairs, use the following procedures.

step1.para: With the cab in the down position, remove both left and right rams from the cab hinge. This can be accomplished by turning the steering wheel to the left and right to have access to the ram lock pin. Remove lock pin from clevis pin, then remove clevis pin. Ram will fall free from the cab hinge. Repeat this procedure for each ram.

Using a chain or lift strap connected to a lift hoist, place the chain/strap hooks to lock under the back of cab as shown in Figure 12. Place a suitable piece of wood between the cab and lift hook as not to damage the back of cab.

note.para: Make sure that the lift hooks, when placed at the back of the cab tunnel, DO NOT catch or pinch any of the lines that are routed in that area.

step1.para: Using a lifting hoist, lift cab slowly only to the point where you have enough room to do your necessary repairs to the hydraulic system.

note.para: Use a suitable safety prop to support the cab.

step1.para: After repairs are made, remove safety prop. Lower cab; leave lift chain/strap attached.

Attach left and right side rams to cab hinges. It may be necessary to raise the cab slightly with the hoist to align the clevis pins. Install clevis pins and clevis lock pins. Remove hoist lift chain/strap from back of cab.

Check cab operation. It may be necessary to bleed the cab hydraulic system. Refer to BLEEDING THE CAB HYDRAULIC SYSTEM
.
